title: Insertion Sort
subject: Algorithms
theory:
Build sorted array one item at a time. Pick next item and 'insert' it into correct spot in sorted part. 
Like sorting hand of playing cards.

interview_questions.question: Why is Insertion Sort good for small arrays?
interview_questions.answer: Low overhead constants make it faster than Merge/Quick sort for n < 20-50.

real_world_use_cases.description: If data is almost sorted, Insertion sort runs in near O(n).

summary: The best of the O(n^2) sorts.
